Problem.msg: The test configuration contains the following deprecated rules, which will be removed in future releases:

Error.val: The rule SEC.CDR has been deprecated and should be replaced with BD.RES.LEAKS in your test configuration.
The rule SPR.VPPD has been deprecated and should be replaced with SEC.VPPD in your test configuration.
The rule PB.CFSRLV has been deprecated and should be replaced with BD.RES.LEAKS in your test configuration.
The rule SEC.CDBC has been deprecated and should be replaced with BD.RES.LEAKS in your test configuration.
The rule SEC.CDRLV has been deprecated and should be replaced with BD.RES.LEAKS in your test configuration.
The rule GC.UFID has been deprecated and should be replaced with BD.RES.LEAKS in your test configuration.
The rule SEC.CDBCLV has been deprecated and should be replaced with BD.RES.LEAKS in your test configuration.
The rule OOM.FCSF has been deprecated and should be replaced with METRIC.NOMCIM in your test configuration.
The rule SPR.VPPDIMPL has been deprecated and should be replaced with SEC.VPPD in your test configuration.
MS Code Analysis failed on webapp-hello-world

Problem.msg: Some static analysis rules are not supported for .NET Core/.NET Standard projects and were not executed during the analysis. See the dotTEST User Guide for the list of supported rules.

Rule.desc: Do not use non-generic collection for class fields
Do not use non-generic collection for making custom collection class
Do not declare local variables of non-generic collections types
Do not use non-generic collection for local variable
Collection should implement ICollection<T>
Avoid indexer in non-collection class
Make sure implementation of Object.Equals(Object) properly handles null values
Make sure implementation of Object.Equals(Object) is reflexive
Do not modify collection while iterating over it
Avoid ArgumentNullException
Avoid NullReferenceException
Ensure that invoke parameter type correspond to delegate definition
Avoid use before explicit initialization
Do not base equality on the equality of hash codes
Avoid division by zero
Avoid accessing arrays out of bounds
Avoid conditions that always evaluate to the same value
Consistently check the returned value of non-void methods
Avoid dereferencing before checking for null
Do not use disposed resources
Do not use managed resources in finalizers
Avoid integer overflows
Avoid overwriting method parameters before each use
Do not append null value to strings
Avoid switch with unreachable branches
Ensure proper usage of StringBuilder objects
Avoid unused values
Ensure resources are deallocated
Prevent untrusted inputs that may affect authorization
Prevent security vulnerability (custom rule)
Always revert the context of an impersonated user to the previous identity
Prevent exposure of sensitive data
Validate potentially tainted data before it is used to determine the size of memory allocation
Protect against command injection
Validate potentially tainted data before it is used in methods that generate code
Protect against file name injection
Exclude unsanitized user input from format strings
Protect against LDAP injection
Protect against log forging
Protect against network resource injection
Protect against HTTP response splitting
Protect against Reflection injection
Protect against SQL query injection
Protect against SQL connection injection

Protect against using unprotected credentials
Use object with secure XmlResolver property
Do not abandon unreleased mutexes
Do not acquire locks in different order
Variable should be used in context of single critical section
Do not use an instance lock to protect shared static data
Avoid hiding methods from base classes
Avoid hiding properties from base classes
Always provide names for threads
Use 'L' instead of 'l' to express 'long' integer constants
Avoid 'protected' access for members of 'sealed' classes
Use positive instead of negative terms for naming properies/methods that return a 'boolean'
Use plural name for a property of type collection/array and avoid collection/array in the name
Use 'Is...' only for naming methods that return a "boolean"
Keep line length within predefined parameters
Do not declare multiple Main methods in a single assembly
Always provide appropriate file header (copyright information, etc.)
Use spaces for tabs/indentation
Avoid class, struct, or interface names which are more than 14 characters long
Members should be commented
Types should be commented
Do not declare virtual members in sealed types
Validate arguments of public methods
Implement IDisposable correctly
Do not raise exceptions in unexpected locations
Avoid duplicate accelerators
Do not hardcode locale specific strings
P/Invokes should not be visible
Call GetLastError immediately after P/Invoke
Do not ignore method results
Call GC.SuppressFinalize correctly
P/Invoke declarations should be portable
Use only API from targeted framework
Avoid calling problematic methods
Do not lock on objects with weak identity
Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Specify marshaling for P/Invoke string arguments
Review imperative security
Secure asserts
Review deny and permit only usage
Review declarative security on value types
Review visible event handlers
Secured types should not expose fields
Method security should be a superset of type
Call GC.KeepAlive when using native resources
APTCA methods should only call APTCA methods
APTCA types should only extend APTCA base types
Review SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute usage
Secure serialization constructors

Override link demands should be identical to base
Wrap vulnerable finally clauses in outer try
Type link demands require inheritance demands
Security critical constants should be transparent
Security critical types may not participate in type equivalence
Default constructors must be at least as critical as base type default constructors
Delegates must bind to methods with consistent transparency
Methods must keep consistent transparency when overriding base methods
Level 2 assemblies should not contain LinkDemands
Members should not have conflicting transparency annotations
Transparent methods must contain only verifiable IL
Transparent methods must not call methods with the SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurity attribute
Transparent methods may not use the HandleProcessCorruptingExceptions attribute
Transparent code must not reference security critical items
Transparent methods must not satisfy LinkDemands
Transparent code should not be protected with LinkDemands
Transparent methods should not use security demands

Transparent methods should not be decorated with the SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute
Types must be at least as critical as their base types and interfaces
Transparent code may not use security asserts
Transparent methods must not call into native code
Do not raise reserved exception types

Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod

Mark Windows Forms entry points with STAThread

Provide correct arguments to formatting methods
Test for NaN correctly
P/Invoke declarations should not be safe-critical

Override methods on comparable types

Always provide default parameterless constructor in xml serialized class
Do not use interface type for xml serialized property or field
Make type used in xml serialization 'public'
Provide setter for xml serialized properties
Ensure all sensitive function invocations are logged
Avoid hard coded connection strings
Do not pass exception messages into output in order to prevent the application from leaking sensitive information
Avoid select * statements
Do not call tainted methods outside the wrapper methods
Ensure all 'dangerous' functions are called within wrapper methods
Avoid calling Thread.Abort()
Avoid calling Thread.Sleep()
Attribute classes should be sealed (NotInheritable in Visual Basic)
Avoid identical positional and named arguments
Define a property for each positional argument
Specify attribute usage when defining a custom attribute
Use flags attribute for bit field enum
Define a protected constructor in each abstract (MustInherit in Visual Basic) class
Use template methods
Provide at least one implementation for each abstract (MustInherit in Visual Basic) class
Do not hide inherited fields
Use enumerations instead of constant or static readonly fields
Use Int32 as the base type of enums
Avoid declaring events on enum
Avoid declaring methods on enum
Avoid declaring properties on enum
Do not use non-integral enum
Avoid using nested classes outside the nesting class
Avoid unused nested private types
Mark a class as sealed (NotInheritable in Visual Basic) if it will not be necessary to derive from it
Mark a class as static if all members are static
Enforce custom attribute ImmutableAtomic
Avoid large structs (Structure in Visual Basic)
Use string.Empty for empty strings
Use preferred names for primitive types
Call the Finalize method of the base class from the finalizer in the derived class
Provide 'Case Else' for each 'Select Case' statement
Avoid controls out of bounds of a grid
Make sure that all Static Resources have default public constructors
